snippet: One of the candidates is calling the results of the presidential election fraudulent. But stoking outrage among his supporters does not ensure a peaceful outcome.
abstract: Editorial cautions that Afghan presidential candidate Abdullah Abdullah is stoking dangerous animosities at home by declaring election coup and threatening to establish parallel government; observes that fears of election fraud are deeply rooted in ethnic divisions; holds that Abdullah would better serve country by joining with opponent Ashraf Ghani to ensure credible and peaceful outcome.
lead_paragraph: One of the candidates is calling the results of the presidential election fraudulent. But stoking outrage among his supporters does not ensure a peaceful outcome.
